comment: She is the sweetest and most caring teacher you'll ever have! She loves what she does and she is so smart, and she has been so helpful during the transition to online school and she cares so much about students doing well and learning.

Professor Walthour is probably one of the best teachers for CRJU at KSU if you're looking to understand the subject then I HIGHLY recommend you take her class She's one of the few professors who actually care about their students. 10/10 would take her class and take her with out a second thought. Make sure to take good notes for her tests.

Just such a sweet teacher. She genuinely cares so so much about each and every student. The textbook had all the material needed to pass any quiz or test. Her lectures are always funny and still informational. Shes super lenient and not a harsh grader. She loves when you participate, so look out for that. Would love to have her as a teacher again!

Best professor ever! She's super kind and sweet. Please do come to class because it's totally worth it and you'll love her! If you're extremely antisocial, this might not be for you due to class discussions but honestly she was really easy to talk to. She's an easy grader, two tests and one group project that's super easy!
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I love Professor Walthour, this was my second time taking her. She has good lectures, but beware, if you do not like open discussions or participating, she is not meant for you! Attendance is required to pass. Lots of students would skip her class and then show up for the midterm just to utterly fail. She is so kind and caring. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She's very loud and entertaining. Show up to class and let her get to know you and you get 100 on participation which is 25% of the grade. If you can't show up, email her literally any excuse and she'll forget about it. Her tests make you think, but not too bad. Only gripe is how condescending she was towards us while going over exams
FAVORITE PROFESSOR! If you have a passion for Criminal Justice or Law in general take her. She is worth it.
Dr. Walthour was awesome! Very personable and hilarious. Make sure to participate in class discussions, and to take really good notes. Those will both help you in the long run!

Literally one of the best professors I've ever had! She's amazing. She's passionate about teaching and you can definitely tell! She's very knowledgeable on the subject seeing as how she worked in the field as a lawyer for a long time. She's very nice and she'll go the extra mile to help you succeed! Truly a gem & I loved her a teacher and person!

She is such a great teacher. Midterm & final are open notes(No limitations). She expects you to read and be prepared for in class discussion, that's it! Doesn't stress about homework as long as it's all turned in before midterm or the final, and there's 1 case brief "project" that can be presented however you want. Literally got a 100 in the class.

Prof. Walthour is one of my favorite professors because she is very understanding. Her two tests were open note and were pretty easy. There is also a Court Observation assignment (1-3 pages long) and an oral presentation that was extremely easy. I'd recommend coming to class everyday and reading chapters prior to the day they're discussed
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Walthour id the sweetest professor ever. She is so experienced with Criminal Procedure and she wants the best for her students. She will give you all the information you will need to pass, however, make sure you go to class because she doesn't use D2L much.

Professor Walthour is an amazing professor with years of experience as a lawyer. As far as the class goes you are expected to read before every class. She loves to ask the class questions & your in-class participation counts, so it's wise to be prepared. There are 2 tests, 1 major case brief project, as well as 5 case briefs for each chapter.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Ms. Walthour is one of the best professor's I have ever had. She truly cares about not only her students but what she is teaching. She wants her students to understand and will go above and beyond to make sure you do. She has an abundance of knowledge about law because she was a defense attorney and prosector for 30 years. TAKE HER CLASS!
Amazing teacher. Wants her students to pass, trust her students, and very patient. Definitely recommend her

Great teacher. Cares a lot about her students and passing. Because she is a practicing attorney she knew so much and when she didn't know something she had no problem with us using Google to figure it out. Her class was fun and the discussions were always fun and engaging.  Open note tests midterm and final, easy group project and court observation

As both a former prosecutor and defense attorney, she knows her stuff. She is all about class discussion, which is typically not my forte, but her warmness towards her students really makes you feel comfortable enough to engage in the classroom.  Wanted us to do well. My desire to go to law school increased exponentially after taking her class. A++

Can't recommend this professor high enough!! Courts sucks as a class but she makes it so easy. Two tests that are open notes,  a super easy court observation that we did day before, easy group presentation and that's it. Just participate in class and you will pass easily. Book only needed for project and notes. attendance is mandatory, yet slack.
